intro: Sagenia thwaitesii, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late winter or early spring. The plant produces a tall, leafless stem that bears clusters of white or pale blue flowers. Its bulbs are adapted for storage, allowing it to survive dry periods and regenerate in favorable conditions. Sagenia thwaitesii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained soil with adequate sunlight.
